predictions.text: U.S. Nonfarm Payrolls (total, seasonally adjusted) for November 2025 will print between +120,000 and +220,000.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the initial headline change in total nonfarm payroll employment in the BLS Employment Situation news release (Table B-1 headline figure or release summary).
monitoring_signals: ADP National Employment Report
Initial and continuing jobless claims
Challenger, Gray & Christmas layoff announcements
ISM Manufacturing and Services Employment indices
Job postings trends (Indeed, LinkUp)
predictions.rationale: Labor demand is cooling but still positive; claims are contained. A modest payroll gain is consistent with mixed business surveys and elevated layoff announcements.

predictions.text: U.S. Average Weekly Hours (Total Private, seasonally adjusted) for November 2025 will print between 34.2 and 34.4 hours.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check BLS Employment Situation, series for Average Weekly Hours of All Employees: Total Private (FRED: AWHAEMAN or BLS CES0500000002). Use the initial release value.
monitoring_signals: Manufacturing hours in ISM Manufacturing
Service-sector activity in ISM Services
Announcements of overtime reductions by large employers
predictions.rationale: Average weekly hours are historically stable near 34.3; modest demand softness suggests limited deviation.

predictions.text: U.S. Labor Force Participation Rate (seasonally adjusted) for November 2025 will print between 62.5% and 62.9%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm in BLS Employment Situation (Household Survey), series LNS11300000. Use the initial reported rate.
monitoring_signals: Prime-age (25–54) participation trends
Household survey employment growth
Immigration and population growth estimates
predictions.rationale: Participation has been range-bound; incremental labor supply from demographics and immigration points to a stable reading.

predictions.text: University of Michigan 1-year inflation expectations (preliminary) for December 2025 will print between 2.7% and 3.5%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in the University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers preliminary release; use the headline 1-year inflation expectations value.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline prices trend (AAA/EIA)
CPI and PCE recent prints
Consumer sentiment headline and expectations components
predictions.rationale: Short-term expectations have eased alongside disinflation and lower fuel prices but remain sensitive; a 2.7–3.5% band captures typical volatility.

predictions.text: China CPI (headline, YoY, NSA) for November 2025 will print between -0.3% and +0.5%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check China NBS CPI year-over-year headline inflation in the official monthly release; use the initially published YoY rate.
monitoring_signals: Food prices (particularly pork) and energy prices in China
PMI input/output price indices
CNY exchange rate moves and import prices
predictions.rationale: Weak domestic demand and prior deflationary pressures suggest subdued inflation around zero.

predictions.text: OFAC will announce at least one Iran-related sanctions designation via a U.S. Treasury press release by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A U.S. Treasury press release on treasury.gov explicitly listing new Iran-related SDN designations by OFAC before 2026-01-01 UTC.
monitoring_signals: Regional escalation involving Iran or proxies
Congressional or White House statements on Iran
EU/UK parallel Iran designations
predictions.rationale: Year-end sanction packages are common; geopolitical tensions keep Iran actions likely.

predictions.text: Cisco PSIRT will publish at least two security advisories in December 2025 with CVSS v3.x Base Score ≥ 9.8.
predictions.verification_criteria: Count distinct December 2025 Cisco PSIRT advisories on tools.cisco.com with CVSS v3.x Base Score ≥ 9.8; publication date in December UTC.
monitoring_signals: Talos blog previews of critical Cisco bugs
CISA KEV additions referencing Cisco
Exploit activity noted by security vendors
predictions.rationale: Cisco often batches critical fixes; two in a month is plausible but not assured.

predictions.text: Nasdaq-100 Index (NDX) will close at a new all-time high on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the highest-ever official NDX closing level by 2025-12-31 UTC using Nasdaq index data.
monitoring_signals: Mega-cap tech earnings revisions and guidance
Buyback announcements/dividend increases
Rates trajectory (U.S. 10Y yield) and financial conditions
predictions.rationale: AI-driven mega-cap momentum, pricing power, and strong balance sheets support incremental highs into year-end.

predictions.text: In at least one Weekly Petroleum Status Report released by 2025-12-31, U.S. motor gasoline stocks will increase by at least 5.0 million barrels week-over-week.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report; compare total motor gasoline stocks week-over-week. A qualifying report shows a ≥ +5.0 million barrel change.
monitoring_signals: Refinery utilization rates and turnaround schedules
Import levels and blending components
Demand (product supplied) seasonality
predictions.rationale: Seasonal builds are common in December as refiners increase output while demand softens post-Thanksgiving.

predictions.text: Android’s December 2025 Security Bulletin will include at least one Critical-severity remote code execution vulnerability in Framework, System, or Media components.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm on source.android.com/security/bulletin/2025-12 with a listed CVE marked Critical and RCE in Framework, System, or Media.
monitoring_signals: Preview disclosures from OEM advisories (Samsung, Pixel)
Project Zero and security vendor pre-briefs
CVE assignment activity for Android components
predictions.rationale: Android monthly bulletins frequently include at least one Critical RCE in core components.

predictions.text: NOAA SWPC will issue at least one S3 (Strong) Solar Radiation Storm alert or warning by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify an NOAA SWPC alert or warning explicitly labeled S3 (Strong) Solar Radiation Storm posted before 2026-01-01 UTC.
monitoring_signals: Solar active region counts and flare forecasts
Solar proton flux (GOES) rising toward thresholds
NOAA watches indicating elevated risk
predictions.rationale: Solar Cycle 25 activity remains elevated near peak, increasing odds of an S3 event in December.

predictions.text: U.S. PCE Price Index (headline, YoY, NSA) for November 2025 will print between 2.5% and 2.9%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check BEA Personal Income and Outlays release; use the headline PCE Price Index year-over-year rate as initially reported.
monitoring_signals: CPI/PPI monthly prints and components mapping to PCE
Health care and housing services components
Gasoline prices into November
predictions.rationale: Disinflation continues with energy relief and moderating core services; YoY PCE likely high-2% range.

predictions.text: NFIB Small Business Optimism Index for November 2025 will print between 90.0 and 92.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the headline NFIB Small Business Optimism Index level in NFIB’s official November 2025 release.
monitoring_signals: NFIB hiring plans and compensation subindices
Rates and credit conditions for small firms
Retail sales trends for small businesses
predictions.rationale: Small-business sentiment remains subdued but stable amid softer demand and easing cost pressures.
